org.ctoolkit.restapi.client

Class ApiCredential

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<Object,Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • org.ctoolkit.restapi.client.ApiCredential
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Object,Object>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RequestCredential

    public class ApiCredential
extends Properties
    The API credential holder represents a map of credential used to authenticate client calls to APIs. Default credential will be always used if any specific wouldn't be found. Specific credential that are dedicated to a concrete API are optional unless default credential are defined.

    Values are part of the binding thus available via injection like: 

       public class MyClass {
     @Inject @Named("credential.default.clientId") String clientId;
     ...
   }
    Author:
    Aurel Medvegy
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected String getStringValue(String property)
      Searches for the property with the specified key in this property list.
      ApiCredential setApiKey(String apiKey)
      Sets the API Key to be used with any API that supports it.
      ApiCredential setApplicationName(String applicationName)
      Sets the name of the client application.
      ApiCredential setClientId(String clientId)
      Sets the Google API OAuth 2.0 Client ID Credential.
      ApiCredential setCredentialOn(boolean credentialOn)
      Sets the boolean identification whether current environment should use these credential in order to authenticate client calls or use cloud native environment for authentication.
      ApiCredential setDisableGZipContent(boolean disable)
      Sets whether to disable GZip compression of HTTP content.
      ApiCredential setEndpointUrl(String endpointUrl)
      Sets the backend service API endpoint URL to be called.
      ApiCredential setFileName(String fileName)
      Sets the path name to the private key file.
      ApiCredential setFileNameJsonStream(String fileName)
      Sets the path name to the json stream file which contains private key, service account email, client id and others.
      ApiCredential setNumberOfRetries(int numberOfRetries)
      Sets the number of retries that will be allowed to execute before the request will be terminated or 0 to not retry requests.
      ApiCredential setProjectId(String projectId)
      Sets the Google Cloud Project ID also known as applicationId (AppId).
      ApiCredential setRequestReadTimeout(int readTimeout)
      Sets the timeout in milliseconds to read data from an established connection or 0 for an infinite timeout.
      ApiCredential setServiceAccountEmail(String serviceEmail)
      Sets the service account ID (typically an e-mail address).

      • prefix

    • Constructor Detail

      • ApiCredential

        public ApiCredential()
        Creates default credential used to authenticate all calls unless specified another instance for a specific API. Setting following properties will be configured as default credential.
        • setProjectId(String)
        • setClientId(String)
        • setDisableGZipContent(boolean)
        • setServiceAccountEmail(String)
        • setApplicationName(String)
        • setFileName(String)
        • setFileNameJsonStream(String) (String)}
        • setApiKey(String)
        • setEndpointUrl(String)
        • setCredentialOn(boolean)
        • setNumberOfRetries(int)
        • setRequestReadTimeout(int)

      • ApiCredential

        public ApiCredential(String prefix)
        Creates specific credential used to authenticate calls to a specific API. Setting following properties will be configured as specific credential - prefix based.
        • setProjectId(String)
        • setClientId(String)
        • setDisableGZipContent(boolean)
        • setServiceAccountEmail(String)
        • setApplicationName(String)
        • setFileName(String)
        • setFileNameJsonStream(String) (String)}
        • setApiKey(String)
        • setEndpointUrl(String)
        • setCredentialOn(boolean)
        • setNumberOfRetries(int)
        • setRequestReadTimeout(int)
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix used to identify specific credential

      • ApiCredential

        protected ApiCredential(@Nonnull
             Map<String,String> properties,
             String prefix)
        Creates credential map used to authenticate API calls. It's client responsibility to make sure that map has at least a default credential configured.

        • credential.default.projectId
        • credential.default.clientId
        • credential.default.disableGZipContent
        • credential.default.serviceAccountEmail
        • credential.default.appName
        • credential.default.fileName
        • credential.default.fileNameJsonStream
        • credential.default.apiKey
        • credential.default.endpointUrl
        • credential.default.credentialOn
        • credential.default.numberOfRetries
        • credential.default.readTimeout
        • credential.drive.projectId
        • credential.drive.clientId
        • ..
        Parameters:
        properties - the map of credential and config properties
        prefix - the base prefix of this credential instance

      • setDisableGZipContent

        public ApiCredential setDisableGZipContent(boolean disable)
        Sets whether to disable GZip compression of HTTP content.

        By default it's false if not set.

        Parameters:
        disable - true to disable GZip compression. Otherwise HTTP content will be compressed.
        Returns:
        this instance to chain

      • setServiceAccountEmail

        public ApiCredential setServiceAccountEmail(String serviceEmail)
        Sets the service account ID (typically an e-mail address).
        Parameters:
        serviceEmail - the service email
        Returns:
        this instance to chain

      • setApplicationName

        public ApiCredential setApplicationName(String applicationName)
        Sets the name of the client application. If the application name is null or blank, the application will use default name DEFAULT_APP_NAME.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - the application name to be used as caller name
        Returns:
        this instance to chain

      • setFileName

        public ApiCredential setFileName(String fileName)
        Sets the path name to the private key file.

        Use package relative path for example '/biz/turnonline/server/impl/PrivateKeyFile.p12' or locate the private key file in resource package org.ctoolkit.restapi.client.googleapis directory - 'PrivateKeyFile.p12'.

        Parameters:
        fileName - the relative path to file
        Returns:
        this instance to chain

      • setFileNameJsonStream

        public ApiCredential setFileNameJsonStream(String fileName)
        Sets the path name to the json stream file which contains private key, service account email, client id and others.

        Use package relative path for example '/biz/turnonline/server/impl/secret.json' or locate the json stream file in resource package org.ctoolkit.restapi.client.googleapis directory - 'secret.json'.

        Parameters:
        fileName - the relative path to file
        Returns:
        this instance to chain

      • setCredentialOn

        public ApiCredential setCredentialOn(boolean credentialOn)
        Sets the boolean identification whether current environment should use these credential in order to authenticate client calls or use cloud native environment for authentication.
        Parameters:
        credentialOn - true use these credential in order to authenticate calls
        Returns:
        this instance to chain

      • setNumberOfRetries

        public ApiCredential setNumberOfRetries(int numberOfRetries)
        Sets the number of retries that will be allowed to execute before the request will be terminated or 0 to not retry requests.

        The default value is 1.

        Parameters:
        numberOfRetries - the number of retries
        Returns:
        this instance to chain

      • setRequestReadTimeout

        public ApiCredential setRequestReadTimeout(int readTimeout)
        Sets the timeout in milliseconds to read data from an established connection or 0 for an infinite timeout.

        By default it is 20000 (20 seconds).

        Parameters:
        readTimeout - the request read timeout to be set
        Returns:
        this instance to chain
